text.Department of Modern Languages and Liter: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

p.The B.A in French and Francophone Studie: The B.A in French and Francophone Studies focuses on the study of languages, cultures and literatures in France and in the numerous countries where French is spoken, as the official or second language. It consists of 36 credit hours at the 3000 and 4000 level.
p.Placement in Modern Language courses is: Placement in Modern Language courses is based on one year of high school language being equivalent to one semester of college work. For example, four years of high school French may place the student in the first semester of the third year. Native speakers, or students who have received advanced education in French-speaking societies, may not take lower division French courses. They can, with their advisor's consent, substitute other upper division level courses for FRE 3780 , FRE 3420, FRE 4422, FRE 3760, and FRE 4421.

li.Students who change degree programs and: Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
li.36 credits in French must be taken at th: 36 credits in French must be taken at the 3000 level or above in FRW, FRE, FRT and FOW courses.
li.At least six of the 36 French credits mu: At least six of the 36 French credits must be at the 4000 level.
li.Earn at least a \"C\" (2.0) in all cours: Earn at least a "C" (2.0) in all courses.
li.Departmental Residency Requirement consi: Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 18 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF Department of Modern Languages and Literatures.
li.Language credit by exam will not be give: Language credit by exam will not be given in courses lower in level than those in which students are presently enrolled.
li.Co-op or internship credit cannot be use: Co-op or internship credit cannot be used in this major.
li.Students must see a French advisor to ob: Students must see a French advisor to obtain proper counseling and have their schedule approved before registering for courses in their major.
li.Courses designated in Gen Ed Program and: Courses designated in Gen Ed Program and Common Program Prerequisites are usually completed in the first 60 hours.

courseSection0.text:
The B.A in French and Francophone Studies focuses on the study of languages, cultures and literatures in France and in the numerous countries where French is spoken, as the official or second language. It consists of 36 credit hours at the 3000 and 4000 level.
Placement in Modern Language courses is based on one year of high school language being equivalent to one semester of college work. For example, four years of high school French may place the student in the first semester of the third year. Native speakers, or students who have received advanced education in French-speaking societies, may not take lower division French courses. They can, with their advisor's consent, substitute other upper division level courses for FRE 3780 , FRE 3420, FRE 4422, FRE 3760, and FRE 4421.
Admission Requirements
None
Degree Requirements
Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
36 credits in French must be taken at the 3000 level or above in FRW, FRE, FRT and FOW courses.
At least six of the 36 French credits must be at the 4000 level.
Earn at least a "C" (2.0) in all courses.
Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 18 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF Department of Modern Languages and Literatures.
Language credit by exam will not be given in courses lower in level than those in which students are presently enrolled.
Co-op or internship credit cannot be used in this major.
Students must see a French advisor to obtain proper counseling and have their schedule approved before registering for courses in their major.
Courses designated in Gen Ed Program and Common Program Prerequisites are usually completed in the first 60 hours.

li.Select primarily from upper level course: Select primarily from upper level courses after meeting with a departmental advisor. Courses may be outside the department.
li.Signature Experience requirement is met: Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):
li.Earn a grade of \"C\" (2.0) or higher in: Earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or higher in at least 36 hours of upper division French courses
li.During their last semester, students are: During their last semester, students are required to satisfactorily complete a departmental exit exam, entirely in French. The exam is offered at the end of each October and March and students need the approval of their advisor to take the exam. Students may take the French Exit Exam a maximum of two times. Exceptions must be approved by the student's French advisor and by the French Program Director.
li.Students must submit their Exit Exam and: Students must submit their Exit Exam and Portfolio (FRE 4950C) to the French Faculty by the due date. Students must earn a grade of "S" to successfully complete this requirement.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Students interested in completing Honors: Students interested in completing Honors Undergraduate Thesis (HUT) should contact their program advisor. More information about HUT can be found at https://honors.ucf.edu/honors-undergraduate-thesis/.
li.Lower division courses do not substitute: Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred from private and out: Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated by the department chair for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
li.Program Academic Learning Compacts (stud: Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

courseSection0.text:
Electives

Variable
Select primarily from upper level courses after meeting with a departmental advisor. Courses may be outside the department.

courseSection1.text:
Foreign Language Requirements

Admissions
Met by graduation requirements.
Graduation
Met by Common Program Prerequisites

courseSection2.text:
Additional Requirements

Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):

FRE 4950C - French Portfolio Credit Hours: 0

Required Minors

None

courseSection3.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or higher in at least 36 hours of upper division French courses
During their last semester, students are required to satisfactorily complete a departmental exit exam, entirely in French. The exam is offered at the end of each October and March and students need the approval of their advisor to take the exam. Students may take the French Exit Exam a maximum of two times. Exceptions must be approved by the student's French advisor and by the French Program Director.
Students must submit their Exit Exam and Portfolio (FRE 4950C) to the French Faculty by the due date. Students must earn a grade of "S" to successfully complete this requirement.

courseSection4.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection6.text:
Additional Information

Honors In Major
Students interested in completing Honors Undergraduate Thesis (HUT) should contact their program advisor. More information about HUT can be found at https://honors.ucf.edu/honors-undergraduate-thesis/.
Related Programs
Spanish (B.A.)
Certificates
French Translation and Interpretation Certificate
Related Minors
French Minor
Italian Minor
Judaic Studies Minor
Latin American Studies Minor
Spanish Minor
Advising Notes
None
Transfer Notes
Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated by the department chair for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
None
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
